author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Most Americans say they worry the U.S. will become too involved in Venezuela, according to a survey conducted just after the operation that ousted President Nicolás Maduro from power. In the two-day Reuters/Ipsos survey that concluded Monday, 72 percent of Americans said they are concerned the U.S. might get too involved in Venezuela, while 25…
title: 72 percent worried US will become too involved in Venezuela: Survey

author: Max Rego
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) said Sunday that after the U.S. captured Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, Cuba’s communist regime may be on the way out. “There’s no way that the communist dictatorship in Cuba survives after the takedown of Maduro. It is over, it’s just a matter of time,” Graham told host Trey Gowdy on Fox…
title: Graham: Cuba’s liberation ‘just a matter of time’ after Maduro’s fall

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump’s threats against various countries following the capture of Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro is sending signals to the world that he wants to flex U.S. power as he sees fit globally. A day after the news of Maduro’s capture, Trump floated potential action in other parts of the hemisphere, including Cuba, Mexico and Colombia. He…
title: Trump signals US power flex after Maduro capture

author: Ella Lee
description: A federal judge on Monday denied Rep. LaMonica McIver’s (D-N.J.) bid to dismiss a federal assault charge based on legislative immunity, rejecting for the third time the congresswoman’s arguments that her alleged conduct was protected.   U.S. District Judge Jamel Semper’s ruling enables McIver’s prosecution to proceed closer to trial. She pleaded not guilty to charges she assaulted and interfered with immigration officers at a…
title: Judge refuses to toss assault count against NJ Democrat over legislative immunity

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) said Monday that the American people are “scratching their heads” at President Trump’s threats to other countries after U.S. forces carried out an operation to oust Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro from power. In an interview on MS NOW’s “Morning Joe,” the leading Senate Democrat suggested Trump’s approach in Latin…
title: Schumer: ‘People are scratching their heads’ over Trump threats to other countries after Venezuela operation

author: Julia Mueller
description: Rep. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) is set to replace Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi (D-Ill.) as the top Democrat on the House select panel on competition between the U.S. and China.  A statement on Krishnamoorthi’s plans to step down from the role later this month didn’t cite a specific reason behind the exit, but the move comes as…
title: Khanna replaces Krishnamoorthi as top Democrat on House China panel

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump on Monday responded to news that Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) will not seek reelection in November, citing the fallout over the governor’s handling of a massive fraud scandal.  “Minnesota’s Corrupt Governor will possibly leave office before his Term is up but, in any event, will not be running again because he was…
title: Trump tears into Walz after Minnesota governor drops reelection bid

author: Julia Mueller
description: Top Democrats seen as potential 2028 contenders have ripped President Trump’s stunning military intervention in Venezuela and capture of its leader, Nicolás Maduro, labeling the move a dangerous distraction and calling for better leadership from administration officials. “Maduro is a thug and a criminal. But Donald Trump proposing to ‘run’ Venezuela without a coherent long-term…
title: 2028 Democrats rip Trump’s ouster of Maduro

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen warned on Monday that the long-standing NATO alliance would end if President Trump ordered an attack on Greenland, a semiautonomous territory of the Kingdom of Denmark. In an interview on the Danish broadcaster TV2, Frederiksen responded to Trump’s renewed threats to take over the resource-rich island. “I believe one should take the…
title: Danish prime minister says Trump attack on Greenland would end NATO

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: Ousted Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has brought on an attorney who negotiated WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange’s release.  Attorney Barry Pollack will now represent Maduro as he faces criminal prosecution in New York City after being captured in Venezuela Saturday.  Pollack filed his appearance with the court shortly before Maduro had his first hearing Monday, when he pleaded not guilty to the narco-terrorism charges.  Maduro is…
title: Maduro represented by Julian Assange’s attorney Barry Pollack

author: Filip Timotija
description: Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) fired back at Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth over his threat to demote the senator’s military rank on Monday following the Pentagon’s investigation, saying he “will fight this with everything I’ve got.”  Kelly said that Hegseth wants to send a message to every U.S. service member that if they say something that…
title: Kelly fires back at Hegseth over demotion threat: ‘I will fight this with everything I’ve got’

author: Imran Khalid, opinion contributor
description: The Trump administration's visa sanctions on five prominent European citizens, including former European Commissioner Thierry Breton, has caused a breakdown in the Western alliance and a shift towards a more aggressive economic deterrence posture from the EU.
title: Washington turns a regulatory dispute with Europe into a cold war

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: The end of Nicolás Maduro’s reign is a defeat for socialism and drug traffickers, and a victory for free people in Venezuela, and around the world. Viva la libertad!
title: Venezuelans praise Trump for taking out Maduro

author: Laura Kelly
description: U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Mike Waltz on Monday defended the U.S. capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro as a “law enforcement operation” aimed at apprehending a drug trafficker and international terrorist.  “The United States arrested a narco-trafficker who is now going to stand trial in the United States,” Waltz told an emergency session…
title: Waltz defends Venezuela ‘law enforcement operation’ at UN

author: Dylan McKim
description: Adrian Gonzales, a former school resource officer with Uvalde CISD, faces 29 counts of child endangerment and abandonment for his role in the law enforcement response that day.
title: Jury selection begins in trial of former Uvalde CISD school resource officer

author: Teddy Grant
description: In September, Prince Harry and King Charles reunited in person after a year and a half apart.
title: Prince Harry to regain UK security, clearing path for a family visit: Report

description: The United Nations Security Council held a meeting on Monday morning to discuss the U.S. military operation to capture Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, who now faces trial in New York over charges including narco-trafficking. “We meet at a grave time following the 3 January United States military action in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela,” UN…
title: Watch live: UN Security Council holds emergency meeting on Venezuela

author: Tara Suter
description: President Trump on Sunday pushed back on claims from the Russian government that Ukraine had targeted Russian President Vladimir Putin’s residence with a strike, saying he didn’t believe it happened. “I don’t believe that strike happened,” Trump said in response to a question from NewsNation’s Libbey Dean on Air Force One. “There is something that…
title: Trump pushes back at Kremlin claims Ukraine targeted Putin residence

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Americans can now purchase a starter dose of Novo Nordisk’s weight loss drug Wegovy in pill form, the company announced Monday, pledging widespread availability.  The 1.5 milligram starter dose of a once-daily pill will be available with a prescription starting at $149 a month for patients who purchase it directly through the manufacturer without insurance.  Cash-paying patients will also be able to access the starting dose of the pill…
title: First pill version of Wegovy for obesity launches in US

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Democratic National Committee Chair Ken Martin praised Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) after the governor announced Monday he would be forgoing a bid for a third term. “Today’s decision is entirely consistent with who Tim is. Tim has always believed that leadership isn’t about preserving your own power — it’s about using it to make…
title: DNC chair praises Walz after announcement: ‘Speaks volumes about his character’

author: Filip Timotija
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth moved on Monday to demote Sen. Mark Kelly’s (D-Ariz.) military rank over his participation in a recent video with five other Democrats, in which they reminded U.S. service members that they can refuse illegal orders from higher-ups. Hegseth said in a statement that the Pentagon has initiated retirement grade determination proceedings, also…
title: Hegseth moves to demote Mark Kelly over illegal orders video

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump levied a barrage of new threats against various countries following the U.S. operation capturing Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro over the weekend.  Trump was not shy when asked about what the strike on Venezuela meant for other countries in the region including Cuba and Colombia during his trip back to Washington from Florida on…
title: Trump issues threats against multiple countries following Venezuela strike

author: Laura Kelly
description: The Cuban government claimed that 32 of its citizens were killed during the U.S. military operation that captured Venezuela President Nicolás Maduro and his wife, according to a statement read on Cuban state TV on Sunday night, multiple outlets reported.  The Cuban government said all the dead were members of the Cuban armed forces and…
title: Cuba: 32 citizens killed in US operation in Venezuela

author: Jos Joseph, opinion contributor
description: President Trump has sent U.S. troops into Venezuela to remove Nicolas Maduro from power, but has not provided any details on how the U.S. will run the country or what the next steps are, leaving many questions unanswered.
title: Trump’s Joker mentality comes to Venezuela — ‘Do I really look like a guy with a plan?’

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) early Monday faulted fellow Democrats for their relentless criticism of President Trump’s daring mission to capture Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, calling the operation “a good thing.” Fetterman in an interview on “Fox & Friends” noted that Democrats wanted to oust Maduro from power as much as Republicans did but now that…
title: Fetterman: Venezuela operation ‘a good thing’

author: Douglas Schoen and Carly Cooperman, opinion contributors
description: The redistricting wars in Texas and California virtually made sure of that.
title: Democrats are poised to take the House, but don’t expect a blue wave

author: Mark Mix, opinion contributor
description: Twenty House Republicans teamed up with Democrats to advance a bill that would nullify two of Trump’s signature executive orders.
title: Senators should ignore this anti-Trump bill

author: Tara Suter
description: One person is in custody in the wake of an incident overnight at Vice President Vance’s Ohio home, according to the Secret Service. “An adult male was taken into custody by the Cincinnati Police Department after being detained by U.S. Secret Service personnel for causing property damage, including breaking windows on the exterior of a…
title: One person in custody after incident at Vance home in Ohio

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The NCAA is staring down intensifying criticism over how it determines eligibility and the role name, image and likeness (NIL) money is playing in the recruitment by universities of top football and basketball players.   A growing number of coaches and fans have been raising alarms about NIL’s effect on NCAA basketball, even as much of the sports world is focused on the College Football Playoff. The controversy on the…
title: Gonzaga coach Mark Few’s criticism shines light on NIL, college basketball and Congress

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) may be bracing for a rocky return from winter recess, as mounting frustration among moderate House Republicans over the administration’s handling of foreign policy and health care is expected to reach a breaking point in the new year. Johnson has routinely struggled to keep his caucus unified, as he balances a…
title: Johnson faces growing unrest from House GOP centrists

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Congress is less than a month away from another potential government shutdown, and pressure is mounting on Democratic leaders to have another showdown with President Trump over health care costs and his aggressive use of executive authority. Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer (N.Y.), however, is showing little appetite for another shutdown fight even as liberal…
title: Schumer, Democrats face pressure to wage new shutdown fight

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: GOP lawmakers returning to Capitol Hill are facing a health care bind, with Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies having expired on Dec. 31, 2025, and no clear path forward for extending them. The GOP remains split over whether to extend the subsidies at all. But in December, four Republican centrists, frustrated with party leadership, joined…
title: This week on The Hill: GOP faces health care bind with subsidies expired

author: Max Rego
description: A new report from Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee outlines crimes committed by Jan. 6 rioters since the 2021 attack on the Capitol.  The report, shared with The Hill, notes that at least 23 individuals charged in connection with the sprawling Jan. 6 case committed new crimes between the attack and President Trump’s second…
title: House Judiciary Democrats detail crimes committed by Jan. 6 rioters

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Pope Leo XIV on Sunday underscored the importance of safeguarding Venezuelan sovereignty after U.S. forces captured President Nicolás Maduro and took control of the country’s governance. Speaking in St. Peter’s Square during his Sunday prayer, the first American pope weighed in on the world events and called for the Venezuelan people’s interests to be put…
title: Pope Leo calls for Venezuelan independence after Maduro ouster

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Trump administration officials will brief a select group of lawmakers on Monday on the operation in Venezuela to capture and arrest President Nicolás Maduro and his wife. The briefing on “Operation Absolute Resolve” will involve several administration officials, including Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth, CIA Director John Ratcliffe, Attorney General…
title: Trump administration to brief members of Congress on Venezuela actions Monday

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said Starlink, the company’s satellite internet provider, will provide the service free of charge to the people of Venezuela for the next month. Musk reposted a statement from Starlink’s account on the social platform X, which Musk owns, announcing the policy shift. “Starlink is providing free broadband service to the people…
title: Starlink says it will provide service to people of Venezuela through Feb. 3
